Articles.Content:
Just out of curiosity, I would like to see the stats on the forums on age groups. Thirteen here 8)

(also <13 probably shouldn\'t be here right now)
Like most people my age, I\'m 20.

Like most people my age, I\'m 20.

*blink*

Um....

Anyways, I suddenly feel like an old codger, 34 years of experience!

*grumble grumble*

(something about everyone over 40 being lumped together)

*grumble grumble*

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky
Aww, what\'s the matter, grandpa? ;P

(also <13 probably shouldn\'t be here right now)

Maybe not in the forums, no... But my 2 nephew\'s play the game frequently. They are 9.

(something about everyone over 40 being lumped together)

Just the perspective of the 13-year-old original poster.

Today I turn 36. Timely poll! I think it\'s fantastic that so many younger people are interested in this game and are learning at least a little bit about spaceflight.

(also <13 probably shouldn\'t be here right now)

*cough*

H2oskiKerbal

*cough*

Eh, I see this was moved out of general discussion and into OT..

Don\'t particulary mind, but I put this in GD specifically because it seems like the community definately knows a thing or two more than their fellow peers in the real world...

Also there was no way I was going to make sections above 40, I was too lazy. But it seems that 13 -20 has the gross of the population here on the forums.
Turning 14 really soon

Just the perspective of the 13-year-old original poster.

Today I turn 36.

Happy Birthday young man. ;P

Eh, I see this was moved out of general discussion and into OT..

Don\'t particulary mind, but I put this in GD specifically because it seems like the community definately knows a thing or two more than their fellow peers in the real world...

[mod]It was moved because it has nothing to do with KSP specifically. Forum demographics are a nice metric, but they have no place in the KSP General Discussion forum. Actually, shouldn't this be in the Forum Forum?

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Forum Moderator [/mod]

@TimBarrett

I agree for the most part, but there are a select few (myself inclusive) that should be treated with more respect than their age\'s percentile.

I am an intelligent, respectful 11-year-old, and silent advocate of this cause.
Hip or elderly, So black and white, Where am I if i\'m 21?

It was moved because it has nothing to do with KSP specifically. Forum demographics are a nice metric, but they have no place in the KSP General Discussion forum. Actually, shouldn\'t this be in the Forum Forum?

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Forum Moderator

Hmm.

Okay.
Same but I\'m thirteen. Unlike most people my age I actually care about learning and science and like Astronomy and Physics.

Same but I\'m thirteen. Unlike most people my age I actually care about learning and science and like Astronomy and Physics.

So there\'s someone like me out there? Atleast i\'m not alone stuck in a High-School of CoD lovers. =P
Or worse, Christians (not to be offensive but I am meaning die hard Christians. You have the right to religion but not to shove it in someones face as truth)

Same but I\'m thirteen. Unlike most people my age I actually care about learning and science and like Astronomy and Physics.

c\'mon 13-16 and btw im 14 and i also care about astronomy and physics...i love space, infact i am writing a paper on it in which i talk about things to do with the universe...

Brian Cox is a good person to watch to learn alot about the universe...

Brian Cox is a good person to watch to learn alot about the universe...

If you can stand his annoying particle physicist voice...
17. College. Music Producer.

Wow, I\'m surprised at how young the responses skew. I expected more like myself, children of the Space Age - born a month before Apollo 13, grew up with the Shuttle and the Voyagers and a lot of disappointment that we stopped going to the Moon about the time I started walking (and no sign of going on to Mars, either).

So there\'s someone like me out there? Atleast i\'m not alone stuck in a High-School of CoD lovers. =P

Hallelujah! That makes three!

Wow, I\'m surprised at how young the responses skew. I expected more like myself, children of the Space Age - born a month before Apollo 13, grew up with the Shuttle and the Voyagers and a lot of disappointment that we stopped going to the Moon about the time I started walking (and no sign of going on to Mars, either).

I\'m thankful that the younger generations DO appreciate it. We\'re in such an LEO stagnation right now!

37.

Bah, keep your dog off my lawn. When I was your age, you never heard me be such a disrespectful kid! We had a thing called discipline . . . .

Actually, I\'m proud to be a KSP pusher. I have fostered a whole class full of year 11 addicts, and at least two or three new addicts among my year 10 students.

Plus two little girls of my own who love blowing up Kerbals.
